title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Monday, 25 July 2016 - BBC News
summary: man charged with milton keynes rape .
police dog `` remains stable '' after 12ft fall in line of duty .
girl kicked down stairs of bus .
greg rutherford blasts ioc as `` spineless '' .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from us for today but we 'll be back with you tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest for beds , herts and bucks .
here 's a round-up of some of today 's top stories :
and some good news .
police have just tweeted that eight-year-old zack churchill has been found safe and well .

documents.title: sport team try golf trick shots
text: it 's nearly time for use to go , but before tonight 's closing summary .
the boys from bbc three counties sport went out last week to try and learn from the golf trick shot boys in bedford .
they tried their best - that 's all i 'll say but if you fancy a giggle , watch the video here .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing stotfold boy appeal
text: police are appealing for help in finding an eight-year-old boy who has been missing since this morning .
zach churchill was last seen leaving his home address in dickens boulevard , stotfold , at approximately 11:00 .
he is described as slim with blonde hair and was last seen wearing a navy blue football shirt with 'ivanovic ' on the back , shorts , and orange football boots .
he is believed to have a black and red bmx bike with him .
anyone who has seen him should contact bedfordshire police .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: weather : light showers this evening will clear
text: this evening there 'll be some sunny spells and a few isolated , light showers .
it should be a little easier to sleep tonight with skies clearing at time and lows of around 13c ( 55f ) .
tuesday is looking a similar day to today with sunny spells and a few light showers , although many of us are likely to stay dry .
temperatures in the sunshine around 23c ( 73f ) .
check the latest forecast where you live with bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: parked cars block fire service route to answer 999 call
text: parking is an issue for lots of people across the three counties , but it 's even more of a problem for emergency services when they ca n't answer a 999 call due to vehicles blocking their route :
the fire service went on to tweet that fire engines need `` 10ft ( 3m ) clearance to pass safely '' .
`` please think about your parking as you could be putting the lives of your families , friends and neighbours at risk , '' herts fire control said .
1/6 - whilst responding to an emergency call this morning , @ twitterid could not proceed down park lane , cheshunt due to 2 parked cars
was this the call out to leven drive , waltham cross ?
park lane yellow lines need reinstating .
2/6 - not leaving sufficient space for a fire appliance to get through .
the crew therefore had to find an alternative route delaying their
3/6 - attendance .
the details of the vehicles were passed to @ twitterid would a fire engine be able to get to your house in an emergency ?
no !
fire engine would not be able to get down park lane , walthem cross .

documents.title: 'too soon ' for bedfordshire ccg to comment on ivf proposals
text: we 've contacted bedfordshire ccg about proposals to stop ivf treatment on the nhs .
they say it 's `` too soon '' to comment after the consultation closed yesterday which had more than 1,000 people express their views on the plans .
they say the group has not proposed a blanket ban on services ; some will still be available for patients undergoing cancer treatment , or who have a condition that is likely to make them infertile .

terri and richard clothier , from dunstable , believe that ivf should be funded by bedfordshire ccg and speaking about the proposals to withdraw funding mr clothier said the couple think it 's `` a foregone conclusion '' .
he added : `` we really , really hope that the public opinion card wo n't be played if they do take the decision to withdraw the last allocation . ''
author: Sophie Sulehria
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: where in the three counties meets nice guidelines for ivf ?
text: despite nice guidelines saying the nhs should provide three fresh and three frozen cycles of ivf - in reality , very few authorities do .
figures obtained by bbc three counties radio 's health show found that only two of our local 12 authorities provide all three cycles , the others provide less .
the ccgs that meet the guidelines are luton and east and north hertfordshire .
the consultation by bedfordshire clinical commissioning group is proposing to stop providing any nhs funded cycles in most cases - except in luton .
they 're not the only one doing this , there are others in the east of england .
including mid essex , north east essex and south norfolk .
author: Sophie Sulehria
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: plans may see nhs ivf treatment stopped in bedfordshire
text: couples in bedfordshire , except those in luton , are waiting for a final decision on plans to stop routine nhs fertility services in the county .
bedfordshire is the fourth clinical commissioning group in the east region to make the proposal , but say they have not planned a blanket ban .
at present residents can have one fresh cycle and one frozen cycle .
nice guidelines state that the nhs should provide three fresh cycles and three frozen cycles of ivf treatment .
author: Sophie Sulehria
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel : bin lorry crash shuts lane on a10
text: a lane is shut on the a10 in hertfordshire due to a collision involving a car and a bin lorry .
rtc on a10 between puckeridge & buntingford involving 1 car & a refuse lorry .
luckily no injuries but lane 1 is shut
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: 'road hog ' : cyclist hospitalised after hitting pig
text: a cyclist has been taken to hospital after colliding with a pig on a road in houghton conquest .
emergency services were called just before 09:00 yesterday to london road .
the cyclist , a man in his 40s , was taken to bedford hospital with a facial injury .
it is n't believed to be serious .

documents.title: laptop fire prompts warning
text: firefighters in buckinghamshire are warning people not to leave laptops charging unattended after a fire in stone on saturday .
crews were called to a bedroom fire at a property in oxford road at 21:25 after a fire started in a laptop which had been left on charge on a pile of books .
the occupants of the house escaped safely , but the room was completely damaged by smoke .

documents.title: hospital 'absolutely committed ' to dr kate granger 's message
text: you may have heard the sad news over the weekend that kate granger , a terminally-ill doctor from yorkshire , has died.. she launched a national campaign called `` hello , my name is '' to remind medical staff to introduce themselves to patients .
as a friend of west herts hospitals trust she opened an elderly care unit named after her at watford hospital in 2014 after it launched its # hellomynameis campaign .
today a trust spokesman said it was `` deeply saddened '' to hear of the death of a `` truly remarkable individual '' .

a statement said : `` when kate officially opened our granger unit we found that she had great humility , honesty and humour , as well as her powerful unavoidable message of 'it 's the little things ' that make the difference to our patients .
`` we remain absolutely committed to this simple , very effective message . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: injured police dog was chasing suspected thieves
text: more now on the story of police dog called nero who has broken his neck after falling 12ft ( 3.5m ) while chasing suspected thieves in watford .
the six-year-old german shepherd jumped over railings in pursuit of the suspects on thursday and unbeknown to his handler , there was a significant drop the other side .
police say nero `` landed badly '' and broke his neck in two places but is currently receiving treatment and `` remains stable '' .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dead fox found covered in oil in luton
text: in case you missed this story over the weekend
a dead fox that had been covered in oil and wrapped in a jumper has been discovered in luton .
it was found by a member of the public on a grassed area of oakley road on 11 july , but the rspca has only now sought the public 's help to find out more .
insp lauren bailey described the incident as `` strange '' saying that there was `` no blood , open wounds or marks '' on the fox 's body .
ms bailey said it 's `` important to find out how he ended up this way '' .

documents.title: what 's happening with bhs stores in beds , herts & bucks ?
text: nine stores across the three counties are closing , including luton , stevenage , watford , bedford , st albans , aylesbury and milton keynes .
the store in high wycombe 's eden centre closed on saturday and the shop on the mk1 retail park in milton keynes closes this sunday .
remaining stores in our area have n't been given a date on when they will close , but all bhs shops across the uk will be closed by 20 august .
author: Gail Sanderson
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: sir philip green left bhs on 'life support ' , mps find
text: mps have called on the government to take action against the former owner of bhs , sir philip green , who 's been accused of `` plundering '' the company .
there are nine bhs stores across the three counties .
a damning mps ' report found sir philip extracted large sums and left the business on `` life support '' .
his failure to resolve bhs 's £ 571m pension deficit was a major factor in the firm 's demise , the report added and last month sir philip vowed to mps that he would sort out the `` mess '' .
mp frank field , co-chair of the bhs inquiry carried out by the committees , said sir philip should write a cheque for `` at least '' £ 571m for the bhs pensioners .
there has been no response to the report from sir philip , whose retail empire includes topshop and dorothy perkins .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: police dog 'remains stable ' after 12ft fall
text: thank you for all the well-wishes to pd nero .
he is receiving ongoing treatment at the moment and remains stable .

documents.title: weather watchers : blue skies , rainbows and sunrise
text: we 've had a weekend of rather fine weather across beds , herts and bucks , which our bbc weather watchers have been keeping tabs on .
here are some of our favourite photographs that were sent into our inbox
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: police dog injured in 12ft fall while giving chase
text: thoughts for police dog nero & his handler from @ twitterid get well soon
@ twitterid @ twitterid fingers x 'd .
oh no , poor love .
hope he makes it .
oh dear pd nero - here 's hoping for a full and speedy recovery

documents.title: girl kicked down stairs of bus
text: a 12-year-old girl was kicked down the stairs of a bus in st paul 's walden by a man thought to be in his 40s , police say .
the girl was on the 304 bus for st albans between 16:30 and 17:05 on 18 july .

as she went to get off bus at the strathmore arms pub stop on whitwell road a man , described as black and thin , wearing a black zip-up fleece , with his long hair up in a hat , kicked her from the back .
she fell down the stairs , but was not injured .
police are appealing for anyone who may know the man , who got on the bus outside claire 's accessories in hitchin .

documents.title: wycombe sign midfielder freeman
text: wycombe wanderers have signed midfielder nick freeman on a one-year deal following a successful trial spell .
the 20-year-old former histon player has featured for the chairboys in pre-season games against le havre , brentford and queens park rangers .
`` nick has taken his chance with both hands , '' boss gareth ainsworth told the club website .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: pre-season football round-up
text: watford fc rounded off their pre-season trip to austria with a 0-0 draw with russian side anzhi and mk dons striker nicky maynard was on target in the 2-2 draw at aldershot .
luton manager nathan jones has said the importance of giving striker jack marriott a new contract was shown by his two goals in the 2-1 win over brighton .
stevenage manager darren sarll has played down injury concerns over striker rowan liburd who came off minutes after scoring in their 1-0 win over brighton .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton town pledge to help those affected by venue 360 move
text: last week we told you how luton town 's forthcoming move to a new training ground at venue 360 in the town had caused concern as various sports clubs claimed they were being forced out because the hatters had signed a lease for exclusive use of the land .

luton town have now said that while it 's not the club 's place to deal with other parties whose tenancy agreements may result in them having to relocate , it would do `` all it can to help those affected find alternative venues and potentially offer time-specific access to the facilities '' .

a spokesman said : `` luton town football club hope to help provide solutions that will see certain affected groups , associations and individuals who may find replacement facilities difficult to find , continue to exist and flourish at a hugely exciting time for the area . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: milton keynes seagulls : council 'do n't have legal duty to deal with them '
text: last week i went to a part of milton keynes to investigate seagulls that were causing mayhem .
the birds had taken up residence on an industrial estate near dawson road and were leaving their droppings on people and cars .
we asked for a response from milton keynes council .
a spokesman told me `` technically .
local authorities do n't have a statutory duty to deal with seagulls '' .
he said : `` we are monitoring the situation but there 's not much we can do because as a wild bird seagulls are largely protected .
`` the best method is bird-proofing to deter them from nesting on the flat roof . ''
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: greg rutherford : woburn sands champion blasts 'spineless ' ioc
text: britain 's world and olympic long jump champion , greg rutherford , has labelled the international olympic committee 's ( ioc ) decision not to impose a blanket ban on russian competitors at the rio games as `` spineless '' .
rutherford , from woburn sands , believes the ioc has tried to satisfy everyone but ended up creating a `` messy , grey area that does n't help anyone '' .
he told the guardian : `` i would almost have been happier if the decision had been a bullish refusal to act in any way .
this is a spineless attempt to appear as the nice guy to both sides . ''

ioc president thomas bach said : `` we have set the bar to the limit by establishing a number of very strict criteria which every russian athlete will have to fulfil if he or she wants to participate in the olympic games rio 2016 . ''
well , that 's the ioc board off my xmas card list then
totally wrong decision they took the easy option instead of setting a precident
they bottled it
i think athletes should boycott the opening ceremony and let the russians and ioc have a 5 hrs walk of shame
imagine the backlash if a russian athlete has a pos drugs test during/after rio !
so clean athletes such as tennis players should n't be allowed to compete even when the itf supports their participation ?
they set the wrong precedent with that decision .
i.o.c .
inspiring only cheats .
would you have wanted to be banned if british table tennis was shown to have state organised drug taking ?
you are right .
ioc is spineless .
basically they are saying state-sponsored systematic doping is ok !
totally appalling !
let 's not have drastic overreactions now greg
how big is that fence .
`` oh we 'll leave it to individual governing bodies '' yes , split the work of 1 org into 100+
ty cop out by them
do n't get grumpy or they wo n't let you on the yacht putin bought them ( fsb - do n't bump me off , it was only a joke )
that 's a disgrace ! ! ! !
also not sure if this is accurate but if it is wtf do ioc do
there 's now no difference between a country that did do organised doping , and one that did n't .
absolutely no deterrent .
the colassal squid was the largest thing without a backbone-not anymore.no one knows how it operates-sounds familiar .
wtf
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hungarian grand prix : lewis hamilton takes lead in drivers ' championship
text: hertfordshire 's lewis hamilton leads the formula one drivers ' championship for the first time this season after victory at the hungarian grand prix .
the world champion , from stevenage , controlled the race from the moment he passed mercedes team-mate nico rosberg at the start .
he 's now six points ahead of the german .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: man critical after welwyn garden city crash
text: a man in his 30s is in a critical condition in hospital after a crash in welwyn garden city on saturday afternoon .
he was driving a ford people carrier which collided with a car in broadwater crescent at about 14:00 .
hertfordshire police is appealing for witnesses .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tributes to woman killed in great ouse
text: tributes have been paid to the mother-of-three who died in the river in bedford last week .
it 's thought leanne gordon , who was at the river with her three children on thursday evening , got into difficulties while trying to rescue another child in the great ouse off honey hill road .
dorian alexis , from samsons gym in the town where ms gordon worked , said she was `` really engaging '' and `` much loved '' .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man charged with milton keynes rape
text: a man will appear in court in milton keynes this morning , charged with raping a 14-year-old girl last monday night in the bleak hall area .
the 26-year-old was arrested on friday and is due before magistrates .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : feeling fresher
text: today is due to be mostly dry with sunny spells , but with showers possible this afternoon and feeling much fresher .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 69f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: thanks for joining us again for live news , sport , weather and travel for the three counties - we 'll be here until 18:00 .
if you 've been melting in the humidity , this week we 're being promised fresher weather - a full forecast is coming up soon .
remember , if you 'd like to get in touch , you can email us or send us a tweet .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
